Module weapons.py¶

This module implements all sort of things related to weapons. There are simple weapons, guns and bullets. There are variations of them for enemys, but the main idea remains the same for all the clases.

class src.weapons.Bullet(image_path: tuple, position: tuple, angle_radians: float, damage: int, move_function: function, speed: int)¶

Class representing a bullet. The class is the same for enemies and the player. The bullets needs some parameters, including the trajectory function, to determine damages and such. What should be used to diferentiate from where the bullet comes from is the group it is contained.

Parameters:

  • image_path (tuple) – The path to the bullet image.

  • position (tuple) – The initial position of the bullet.

  • angle_radians (float) – The angle that the bullet is being shoot.

  • damage (int) – The damage the bullet should.

  • move_function (function) – A function to determine the bullet trajectory. This function should take one variable (the time elapsed since the bullet was shoot) and should return only a float or int.

  • speed (int) – The speed of the bullet

update()¶

Updates the bullet. This will make it go futher, acordingly to the trajectory function passed. This ins’t made for being called alone, but to be called when the bullet group is being updated.

Return type:

None

class src.weapons.EnemyGun(image_path, target_pos, stats)¶
class src.weapons.EnemyWeapon(image_path: tuple, target_pos: tuple)¶

Class representing an enemy’s weapon. It changes the rotation implementation so it doesn’t flip the enemy’s image.

Parameters:

  • image_path (tuple) – The path leading to the weapon image

  • target_pos – The initial position to target.

class src.weapons.Gun(image_path, target_pos, stats)¶

Class representing a gun. A gun implements the same thing as weapons, with the addition of the capability of shooting. All the gun peculiaritys, like bullet damage and speed, are set with the dict stats.

Parameters:

  • image_path (tuple) – The path leading to the weapon image

  • target_pos (tuple) – The initial position to target.

  • stats (dict) – A dicitionary containing the gun stats.

shoot()¶

Make the gun shoot. This will create bullets and store them in the bullet_group. If the gun is in cooldown, it’ll do nothing. If a shoot is still occuring, it’ll do nothing too.

Return type:

None

update()¶

Updates the weapon. Besides rotating the weapon, this method also will call tue update method to the gun active bullets.

Return type:

None

class src.weapons.Weapon(image_path: tuple, target_pos: tuple)¶

Class representing a generic weapon in the game. This class is responsible for implementing the weapon rotation based on the target position.

Parameters:

  • image_path (tuple) – The path leading to the weapon image

  • target_pos (tuple) – The initial position to target.

property entity¶

The entity associated with the weapon. The weapon will orbit this entity.

update()¶

Updates the weapon. In this basic weapon, it just rotates it acordingly to the target.

Return type:

None

update_target_position(target_pos: tuple)¶

Updates the position that the weapon should target.

Parameters:

target_pos – The new position to target.

Return type:

None
